subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Hindu Flood: Vishnu as a Fish
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Hindu Flood: Vishnu as a Fish.

hook.text: A tiny fish asks a man for protection. The man helps. The fish grows enormous â€” and saves humanity from a flood.

buildup.text: In Hindu mythology, the god Vishnu appears as Matsya, a fish, to warn the sage Manu of a coming deluge.

discovery.text: Manu builds a boat, saves the Vedas (sacred knowledge), and repopulates the Earth. Sound familiar?

twist.text: The Hindu flood is about divine compassion, not punishment. Vishnu saves humanity because it's worth saving.

climax.text: Same flood, different god, opposite lesson. The Hindu version says the cosmos protects us, not punishes us.

punchline.text: Same flood, different lesson. Hindu myth says the cosmos protects us.

quiz.question: How does the Hindu flood story differ from Noah's?
options: It's about divine compassion, not punishment
